author: Hatty Collier
title: Dylann Roof sentenced to death for killing nine black churchgoers in South Carolina shooting
text:
Tuesday 10 January 2017 22:23 BST Click to followThe Evening Standard Sentenced to death: Dylann Roof AP 
A jury has sentenced Dylann Roof to death for the racially motivated killings of nine black people at a church in South Carolina. 
The self-avowed white supremacist was convicted by the same jury of 33 federal charges, including hate crimes , after he opened fire on the Bible study group at the church in 2015. 
Jurors deliberated for less than three hours. 
He stared straight ahead as the judge read through the jury's verdict findings before announcing his death sentence. 
Roof, who represented himself for the penalty phase, was unrepentant during his closing argument earlier in the day. Death penalty: Dylann Roof appearing via video link during an earlier hearing (EPA) 
He told jurors he still felt the massacre was something he had to do and did not ask that his life be spared. 
"I have the right to ask you to give me a life sentence, but I'm not sure what good it would do anyway," he said. 
Roof told FBI agents when they arrested him a day after the June 17, 2015 killings that he wanted the shootings to bring back segregation or perhaps start a race war. Dylann Roof found guilty of US church killings 
Instead, the slayings had a unifying effect, as South Carolina removed the Confederate flag from its Statehouse for the first time in more than 50 years and other states followed suit, taking down Confederate banners and monuments. Roof had posed with the flag in photos. 
The attacker specifically picked out Emanuel AME Church, the South's oldest black church, to carry out the cold, calculated slaughter, Assistant US Attorney Jay Richardson said. 
The 12 people Roof targeted opened the door for a stranger with a smile, he said. Three people survived the attack. Read more
